text: a. promoting the majority of the borough’s growth towards: i. the borough’s site allocations where significant development opportunities are identified; ii. highly accessible locations which have good links to public transport, walking and cycling networks, and local services; iii. the opportunity areas, as illustrated in figure 6, of the City Fringe, Poplar Riverside, and the Isle of Dogs and South Poplar; and iv. the Central sub-area of the borough, through gradual intensification and optimised site capacity while respecting and enhancing the area’s well-established character. b. promoting comprehensive design and development to ensure co-designed site masterplanning. 2. The council will require development proposals that are within or part of a site allocation to deliver design-led site optimisation that accords and is compatible with the identified land uses, infrastructure requirements and site allocation specific design and delivery principles.
